name: Add / remove EFS instance hosted in GSA2
title: Add / remove EFS instance hosted in GSA2
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/1LS/pages/3166470214 - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Overview

This article provides instructions on how to add or remove EFS instances hosted in GSA2. It covers the general conditions, required information, and step-by-step processes for both setting up new instances and removing existing ones.

Information

This guide focuses on the procedures for managing EFS instances, including the setup of new instances and the removal of existing ones. It outlines the necessary steps, conditions, and responsibilities for each process.

  • General Conditions
  • Required Information
  • Setting Up a New EFS Instance
  • Removing an Existing EFS Instance

General Conditions

For Setting Up a New Instance of EFS

  • A new EFS instance must be set up when an opportunity has been created in Salesforce and Sales has informed 1st Level Support.
  • Use the survey at http://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/gp_interne_beantragungen/ to add a new instance.
  • Optional additional features may include a new domain or SSL certificate.

For Removing an Existing Instance of EFS

  • If a contract is terminated, Sales must inform 1st Level Support before the contract ends.

 

Required Information

  • To remove an instance or deactivate it, the following information is needed: date for deletion, instance, and organization.

 

Setting Up a New EFS Instance

Step 1: Initial Request

1st Level Support is tasked by Sales to set up a new EFS instance.

Step 2: Opportunity Check

1st Level Support checks the corresponding opportunity in Salesforce for any additional appointed features.

Step 3: Customer Clarification

If necessary, 1st Level Support clarifies details with the customer.

Step 4: Questionnaire Completion

Sales, PS, or Support fills out the online questionnaire at http://ww2.efs-survey.com/uc/gp_interne_beantragungen/.

Step 5: Automated Notification

An automatically generated email is sent to 1st Level Support.

Step 6: Information Review

1st Level Support checks for completeness and adds any additional information if needed.

Step 7: Handover to Technical Support

The information is handed over to Technical Support.

Step 8: Instance Setup and User Account Creation

After EFS Technical Support sets up the instance, 1st Level Support creates all requested user accounts and reports execution to the customer.

Step 9: Completion Notification

1st Level Support informs Sales that the task has been completed and can be invoiced.

 

Removing an Existing EFS Instance

For information on removing an existing EFS instance, please refer to the "Deletion of installations" guide.

 

FAQ

When should a new EFS instance be set up?

A new EFS instance should be set up as soon as an opportunity has been created in Salesforce and Sales has informed 1st Level Support about it.

What information is needed to remove or deactivate an instance?

To remove or deactivate an instance, you need the date for deletion, the instance name, and the organization details.

Who is responsible for informing 1st Level Support about contract termination?

Sales is responsible for informing 1st Level Support before a contract ends if it is being terminated.

Tags: EFS, GSA2, instance management, setup process, removal process, 1st Level Support, Technical Support
